Title: Tonkin Cruise
Description:
Traveling from south to North escaping the heat and rain that followed us from HCMC through our adventures to HoiAn and Hue, we were finally in Hanoi. The weather was amazing and my friend and I took no chances with making certain the weather would be perfect.
We booked with Tonkin Cruise because the one day on Halong Bay was all around the best on all our shopping points: first the earliest start and arrival to board the ship of the 1 day cruises we considered. Local pick up at your hotel/hostel in old quarter of Hanoi made it easy to start our day at 7:00 am. We picked up a group of just under 20 people (2 being children under 10). This was accomplished in 40 minutes! By 8:00 am we were leaving Hanoi and made a rest stop for 10 minutes before arriving at Tonkin Harbor to board our ship by 10:40 am, ahead of schedule.

The ship is well maintained, clean and even luxurious for a one day cruise. Beautifully set tables for dining, a dozen lounge chairs to sun on and relax and enough seating all around the outdoor deck areas. There are shaded areas and the main deck entry conversation corners to also make and get to know new friends.

The toilets are all fully functioning, immaculately kept and all around the Tonkin is a lovely ship. Staff are friendly, Captain always has his doors open today hello and food is delicious and varied. Special dietary needs and allergies were also a concern if the staff in initial booking and again on day of cruise.
The route through the limestone hills and islands allowed for a good survey of the Bay and it’s most beautiful views.

We had ample down time between the many events planned: Kayaking, swimming or lounging in hammocks began our days’ events. Land transfer and a cave tour was a break from the ship, landing on Cat Ba Island. A spring roll making class followed as we also enjoyed fresh fruits and tea on our way back to Tonkin Harbor for sunset.

WiFi access is a available—so says the tour informational Booklet, but we were never told of this by our guide.

Our English speaking guide managed to keep us all on schedule and afforded us the promised FULL DAY on the water we wanted from 11am until sunset.

The cruise was US$70/person and booked the night before. All went according to plan promised us.

Beer and other soft drinks are available for a reasonable price onboard. Water was provided on bus to boat and lemon tea while on the boat.

Bus has AC and is clean and comfortable.

All-in-all, an excellent cruise, well managed and guide “Hung” is so pleasant and funny.
Great value for a full day!

You arrive back toHa our by 8:30pm

Title: Ruộng Bậc Thang Sa Pa trail
Description: The trail begins when Lao Chai street connects to main road TL152, few kilometres, you climb down on concrete road. You can get to the point with taxi, motorcycle or walking 30 minutes from Sapa with good pace. In peak season, there are many people with tour guides. We had bad luck as heavy fog was sitting in valley but later got brighter and warmer. The trail will lead you to spot to see the rice fields. You can come back and follow direction to Tan Van village through Muong Hoa valley. Extreme nice mountainous scenery, fresh air and rice field. Good shoes, especially when rains and water and special attention for winter 🥶 time You can spend there whole day but be aware about weather change quickly and get ready with water 💧 or snack

Title: Lao Chai Trail
Description: This trail starts in same point as Ruộng Bậc Thang Sa Pa trail. It is almost ten kilometres long through Muong Hoa valley with hundreds of rice fields, many villages. You can start from Tan Van village or at cross road where Lao Chai street meets TL152. Mostly concrete road, sometimes you pass bikes or smaller truck. Fantastic nature, fields and many local ethnic people selling souvenirs. Good shoes, water needed. Winter time is more challenging for being careful and well dressed than summer person. Sometime, you are lucky to buy something in villages. You meet many local ethnic people selling souvenirs

Title: Cat Co 3 Beach
Description:
Just 2km from the center of the Cat ba shopping center is the most spectacular perfect white sand beach that no western tourists have any idea that it exists.
Catch a taxi to the " Pearl of the Orient Front entrance"
Opposite the entrance is a public walkway to this pristine beautiful white sand beach with sun umbrellas and sun lounges all along.'
Almost no westerners even know about this despite the fact that you could walk to it in 30 mins from the town.
The waves crash in, the view is spectacular, and the landscape is outstanding.
Most western tourists pass through Cat Ba without ever visiting this beach, which is the best-kept secret in town.
